job.name: Emotion_Detection_In_Bing_Images

variable.name: CONTAINER_PLATFORM
variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.

variable.name: CONTAINER_GPU_ENABLED
variable.description: If True, it will activate the use of GPU for the workflow tasks on the selected container platform.

variable.name: CONTAINER_IMAGE
variable.description: Name of the container image being used to run the workflow tasks.

variable.name: SEARCH_TERM
variable.description: Used to specify the user's search terms.

variable.name: LICENCE
variable.description: Filter images by the type of license associated with the site.

variable.name: IMAGE_TYPE
variable.description: Filter images by type (for example, clip art, animated GIFs, or transparent backgrounds).

variable.name: OUTPUT_FORMAT
variable.description: The format of the output file.

variable.name: MARKET
variable.description: Used to specify the market where the results come from, which is typically the market where the user is making the request from.

job.description: Search for images of a person using Azure Bing Image Search then perform an emotion detection using Azure Emotion API.

task.name: BingImageSearch

variable.name: SEARCH_TERM
variable.description: Used to specify the user's search terms.

variable.name: LICENCE
variable.description: Filter images by the type of license associated with the site.

variable.name: IMAGE_TYPE
variable.description: Filter images by type (for example, clip art, animated GIFs, or transparent backgrounds).

variable.name: OUTPUT_FORMAT
variable.description: The format of the output file.

variable.name: MARKET
variable.description: Used to specify the market where the results come from, which is typically the market where the user is making the request from.

task.name: Split
task.description: Defines some input, here strings to be processed.

script.code:
print(variables.get("BING_IMAGE_SEARCH_OUTPUT")) OUTPUT_DATA=variables.get("BING_IMAGE_SEARCH_OUTPUT")["value"] urls=[] for document in OUTPUT_DATA: image_url=str('{0}'.format(document["contentUrl"])) print(image_url) urls.append(image_url)
result=urls print(result) #print("image_urls= ", image_urls)

task.name: Merge
task.description: As a merge operation, we simply print the results from previous tasks.

script.code:
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import copy
print("results=",results) print("values=",results[0].value().decode("utf-8")) merged_html=BeautifulSoup(str(results[0].value().decode("utf-8") )) print('len==',len(results)) i=0 for html in results: if i==0: i=i+1 continue i=i+1 soup = BeautifulSoup(html.value()) print('***************') print('BODY==',soup) for element in soup.body: print('element=====',element) merged_html.body.append(copy.copy(element))
result=str(merged_html).encode('utf-8') resultMetadata.put("file.extension", ".html") resultMetadata.put("file.name", "result.html") resultMetadata.put("content.type", "text/html")

task.name: Emotion_API
task.description: Welcome to the Microsoft Emotion API, which allows you to build more personalized apps with Microsoft as cutting edge cloud-based emotion recognition algorithm. https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/emotion/

variable.name: IMAGE_URL
variable.description: The image that will be used to detect the emotions.
